content:
• Wednesday, August 22, 2012
  • HPQ

    H-P (NYSE:HPQ) says on its earnings call (live blog) it shed 4K jobs in FQ3 as part of its...

    H-P (NYSE:HPQ) says on its earnings call (live blog) it shed 4K jobs in FQ3 as part of its restructuring, and now plans to eliminate 11K in FY12, up from prior guidance of 9K (ed: how bad would FY12 guidance be if not for the extra cuts?). Also mentioned: H-P seeing "competitive" PC/printer pricing (no surprise); printer channel inventory is high; PC component prices are unfavorable; high-density servers (popular with Internet companies) are dilutive to margins, with "business model innovation" needed to compete (Amazon would agree). H-P reverses course, now -3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:01 PM | 10 Comments
  • TXN

    More on International Rectifier and Semtech's earnings: IRF expects FQ1 revenue of $235M-$250M,...

    More on International Rectifier and Semtech's earnings: IRF expects FQ1 revenue of $235M-$250M, below a $274M consensus. The company is closing a California chip manufacturing plant, and resizing a U..K. plant. Semtech expects FQ3 revenue of $148M-$154M and EPS of $0.41-$0.45, below a consensus of $158.6M and $0.47. Are the analog chipmakers just suffering from weak industry demand, or are they also losing share to expanding Texas Instruments (NYSE:TXN)? IRF -4.7% AH. SMTC -4.1%. (IRF PR) (SMTC PR) (ON Semi layoffs)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM
  • CALX

    Calix (NYSE:CALX) +3% AH after announcing it's buying Ericsson's (NASDAQ:ERIC) fiber access...

    Calix (NYSE:CALX) +3% AH after announcing it's buying Ericsson's (NASDAQ:ERIC) fiber access equipment division and forming a reseller agreement with the company. Calix, which expects the deal to be accretive to EPS, claims Ericsson's division offers the industry's highest-capacity GPON fiber solution. Infonetics' Jeff Heynen notes the deal will allow Calix, currently focused on North America, to expand into emerging markets; his firm previously called Ericsson a top-3 GPON vendor.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • HAIN

    More on Hain Celestial (NASDAQ:HAIN): FQ4 comes in mixed, beating on a per share basis but...

    More on Hain Celestial (NASDAQ:HAIN): FQ4 comes in mixed, beating on a per share basis but missing on revenue. Net sales jumped 22% Y/Y on strong sales momentum in all sectors, as well as from strategic acquisitions. The company raises its FY13 EPS estimates to $2.10 - $2.20, above Street consensus estimates of $2.09. The company also acquires U.K. distributor Premier Foods' portfolio of packaged grocery brands including Hartley's, Sun-Pat, Gale's Robertson's and Frank Cooper's. Shares +9.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • HAIN

    Hain Celestial (NASDAQ:HAIN): FQ4 EPS of $0.47 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $350.8M (+22.3% Y/Y)...

    Hain Celestial (NASDAQ:HAIN): FQ4 EPS of $0.47 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $350.8M (+22.3% Y/Y) misses by $15M. Shares +9.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM

    Synopsys (NASDAQ:SNPS): FQ3 EPS of $0.55 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $443.7M (+14.7% Y/Y)...

    Synopsys (NASDAQ:SNPS): FQ3 EPS of $0.55 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $443.7M (+14.7% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +2.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM

    Kayak Software (NASDAQ:KYAK): Q2 EPS of $0.19 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $76.9M (+35.4% Y/Y)...

    Kayak Software (NASDAQ:KYAK): Q2 EPS of $0.19 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $76.9M (+35.4% Y/Y) beats by $1.7M. Shares -4.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • KKD

    Krispy Kreme Doughnuts (KKD): Q2 EPS of $0.07 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $102.1M (+4.3% Y/Y)...

    Krispy Kreme Doughnuts (KKD): Q2 EPS of $0.07 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $102.1M (+4.3% Y/Y) misses by $2M. Shares +7.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • GES

    Guess (NYSE:GES): Q2 EPS of $0.49 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $635M (-6% Y/Y) beats by $5M....

    Guess (NYSE:GES): Q2 EPS of $0.49 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $635M (-6% Y/Y) beats by $5M. Shares -12.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • DLLR

    DFC Global (NASDAQ:DLLR): FQ4 EPS of -$0.08 misses by $0.64. Revenue of $266.7M (+14% Y/Y)...

    DFC Global (NASDAQ:DLLR): FQ4 EPS of -$0.08 misses by $0.64. Revenue of $266.7M (+14% Y/Y) misses by $15M. Shares -7.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • OPK

    Opko Health (OPK +1.6%) has been awarded a NASA contract to implement its Claros-1 point-of-care...

    Opko Health (OPK +1.6%) has been awarded a NASA contract to implement its Claros-1 point-of-care diagnostic platform for use on the International Space Station. OPK will provide a panel of assays, including Vitamin D for bone metabolism, immune health, and inflammation to be used on its portable analyzer.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • KAR

    KAR Auction Services (KAR +5.4%) has approached PE firms to discuss a possible sale of the...

    KAR Auction Services (KAR +5.4%) has approached PE firms to discuss a possible sale of the company in a deal that could top $4B, Reuters reports. KAR, through its used car wholesale auctions arm ADESA, is the no. 2 U.S. vehicle auction company behind Cox Enterprises' Manheim unit.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM

  • The previously down solidly mortgage REIT sector begins to show some green, moving higher in...

    The previously down solidly mortgage REIT sector begins to show some green, moving higher in unison following the Fed minutes. Presumably, the next bond purchase program will be aimed at MBS, of which the mREITs own plenty. The entry of a gorilla buyer into the market will likely drive prices higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • GDOT

    Shares of Green Dot (GDOT +6.5%) spike higher after Sallie Mae announces a refund disbursement...

    Shares of Green Dot (GDOT +6.5%) spike higher after Sallie Mae announces a refund disbursement option for students with a new prepaid debit MasterCard that can be reloaded at Green Dot retail locations. Trading volume on GDOT is surging as at least a few shorts are getting squeezed on the joy ride.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • LUFK

    Lufkin (LUFK +1.1%) is being added to Citigroup's Top Picks Live list, citing valuation and...

    Lufkin (LUFK +1.1%) is being added to Citigroup's Top Picks Live list, citing valuation and improving demand for the company's artificial lift technologies.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • DRYS

    DryShips (DRYS -0.8%) and Paragon Shipping (PRGN -4.7%) are lower on Dahlman Rose's expectations...

    DryShips (DRYS -0.8%) and Paragon Shipping (PRGN -4.7%) are lower on Dahlman Rose's expectations that today's pop in the Baltic Dry Index likely will fade as Chinese steel prices are pressured. The firm notes that spot rates for Atlantic Basin product carriers are pulling back on lighter volumes.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM | 1 Comment

  • Maybe biggest reaction to the dovish FOMC minutes comes from the precious metals, gold adding...

    Maybe biggest reaction to the dovish FOMC minutes comes from the precious metals, gold adding nearly 1% to $1,648/oz., and silver tacking on a similar amount to $29.67. GLD +0.6%, SLV +1.5%. Currencies: The euro adds 50 pips to $1.2526. The pound, aussie, yen, and loonie all get a boost as well. UUP -0.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • LXK

    Lexmark (LXK -4.6%) has steadily sold off over the course of the day. There could be worries...

    Lexmark (LXK -4.6%) has steadily sold off over the course of the day. There could be worries bigger rival H-P (HPQ -3.7%), hurt by Dell's FQ2 report, will report another round of poor results for its printing division (previous) after the bell, in light of the industry's challenges. Lexmark issued a giant Q2 warning and poor Q3 guidance in July.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM | 1 Comment
  • PRTK

    Trancept Pharmaceutical (TSPT +5.8%) bounces on the FDA's listing of the drug maker's insomnia...

    Trancept Pharmaceutical (TSPT +5.8%) bounces on the FDA's listing of the drug maker's insomnia treatment Intermezzo in its "Orange Book." The patent has an expiry of 2029, which gives the company a considerable amount of time to fend off generic competition. The market for sleep aids is enormous, with 79M prescriptions filled annually in the U.S., and each 1% share of that market equates to roughly $150M in Intermezzo sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • IMGN

    ImmunoGen (IMGN +3.7%) moves up after Cowen initiates coverage with an Outperform. The stock has...

    ImmunoGen (IMGN +3.7%) moves up after Cowen initiates coverage with an Outperform. The stock has had a rough month, carving nearly 30% off its market cap following a disappointing FQ4 report on August 3rd. However, the stock appears to have stabilized, so from a valuation standpoint alone it appears there may be room for the shares to run.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM
  • CSIQ

    Canadian Solar (CSIQ +4.2%) rallies on an upgrade to Neutral from Lazard, which is impressed...

    Canadian Solar (CSIQ +4.2%) rallies on an upgrade to Neutral from Lazard, which is impressed with the company's execution. CSIQ, which had 12.5% of its float shorted as of July 31, tumbled last week following a Q2 miss, but has now recouped most of its losses.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • JRCCQ

    Select coal names outperform after a strong showing yesterday followed the U.S. Court of Appeals...

    Select coal names outperform after a strong showing yesterday followed the U.S. Court of Appeals decision to shoot down EPA emissions rules: JRCC +5.9%, ANR +1.9%, ACI +1.1%, CNX +0.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM | 5 Comments
  • HERO

    Hercules Offshore (HERO +2.2%) is maintained at Neutral by Goldman Sachs, but the firm cites...

    Hercules Offshore (HERO +2.2%) is maintained at Neutral by Goldman Sachs, but the firm cites HERO's fleet status report showing continued higher dayrates on the GOM shelf for two major classes of rigs in raising its 2013 and 2014 earnings estimates. The data shows "strong operator activity in the shallow GOM highlighting HERO’s ability to push rates."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM
  • PLCM

    Polycom (PLCM -4.2%) slumps after disclosing P-E firm Sun Capital Partners is trying to back out...

    Polycom (PLCM -4.2%) slumps after disclosing P-E firm Sun Capital Partners is trying to back out of a May deal to acquire Polycom's enterprise cordless phone business for $110M. Polycom says it will file a lawsuit to enforce the terms of the deal - the struggling videoconferencing hardware vendor has been planning to use a large chunk of the proceeds to finance stock buybacks.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • CDMO

    Shares of Peregrine Pharmaceutical (PPHM -17.3%) tank on the back of a negative article in...

    Shares of Peregrine Pharmaceutical (PPHM -17.3%) tank on the back of a negative article in Seeking Alpha that asserts the Phase II results for its cancer drug Bavituximab, also known as Bavi, are "overhyped and inconclusive." SA contributor Apsara Biotech calls the massive, 500% runup in the stock over the past two months "unjustified," and says the company's current $300M market cap is far too high for what the company's really worth.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM | 7 Comments
  • KYAK

    Kayak (KYAK +4.8%) is rallying ahead of today's Q2 report, aided by positive comments from...

    Kayak (KYAK +4.8%) is rallying ahead of today's Q2 report, aided by positive comments from JPMorgan. The firm thinks Kayak will post healthy results in spite of the poor performances delivered by other online travel names, given the travel search engine has little European exposure and doesn't face the "over-monetization issues" seen by peers. Also, Jim Cramer talked favorably about Kayak this morning when asked about the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • CX

    Shares of cement and building materials company Cemex (CX +3.9%) march higher on plans to sell a...

    Shares of cement and building materials company Cemex (CX +3.9%) march higher on plans to sell a minority stake in a Latin American unit to be listed on Colombia's stock exchange, part of the Mexican company's efforts to sell assets to pay down its heavy debt load. Credit Suisse raises its rating, believing the move allows CX to cover most or all the $1B due by March 2013 under its refinancing.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • TMUS

    MetroPCS (PCS -5.2%) and Leap Wireless (LEAP -3.5%) slide after T-Mobile decides to revive its...

    MetroPCS (PCS -5.2%) and Leap Wireless (LEAP -3.5%) slide after T-Mobile decides to revive its unlimited data plans. Sprint (S -1.5%) is off slightly. Low-end carriers have clearly decided to challenge market leaders AT&T (NYSE:T) and Verizon Wireless (VZ, VOD) on price, hoping the latter's de facto price hikes will leave them vulnerable. Will the AT&T/Verizon "duopoly" continue gaining share, or are their latest pricing moves an act of hubris that will backfire?

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM | 12 Comments
  • CHS

    Shares of Chico's FAS (CHS +5.9%) pound out a gain after the retailer beats profit estimates...

    Shares of Chico's FAS (CHS +5.9%) pound out a gain after the retailer beats profit estimates with its Q2 report and issues in-line guidance. A 5.6% increase in comparable sales reflected gains in both the number of transactions and average sale amount. The company added 32 stores (net) during the quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • VVUS

    Shares of (VVUS +3.7%) move up after Director Ernest Mario discloses the purchase of another 5k...

    Shares of (VVUS +3.7%) move up after Director Ernest Mario discloses the purchase of another 5k shares, bringing his total of shares owned up to 45k. The purchase was made on August 20th for a price of $20.75. Mario previously bought 20k shares at an average price of $21.74 earlier in the month.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • TOL

    No bad news is good new for the homebuilders today, as the July Existing Home Sales report comes...

    No bad news is good new for the homebuilders today, as the July Existing Home Sales report comes in largely as expected. Still, today's data shows that existing home sales are sharply underperforming the new home market, as seen in the contrast between today's small sales rise and last Thursday's 6.8% housing permits jump to a cycle-high 812k rate. TOL +4.7%, NVR +0.5%, DHI +5.1%, MDC +5.2%, LEN +4.9%, HOV +4,2%, RYL +4.8%, BZH +3.8%. ETFs: XHB +2%, ITB +2.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • YELP

    Yelp (YELP -5.3%) plunges again (previous) after JMP starts coverage at Market Perform due to...

    Yelp (YELP -5.3%) plunges again (previous) after JMP starts coverage at Market Perform due to concerns about the local reviews site's valuation. Shares are now down 16% on the week, as next Wednesday's lockup expiration continues to loom large.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR -4.8%) slips after receiving a downgrade to Underperform from RBC, which is...

    Clearwire (CLWR -4.8%) slips after receiving a downgrade to Underperform from RBC, which is setting a PT of just $1. Macquarie downgraded shares of the 4G carrier, whose cash burn and debt load have faced intense scrutiny, earlier this month.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM | 4 Comments
  • EBAY

    Shares of eBay (EBAY +4.8%) and Discover Financial Services (DFS +4.5%) shoot higher with...

    Shares of eBay (EBAY +4.8%) and Discover Financial Services (DFS +4.5%) shoot higher with investor enthusiasm stoked up by a mobile payment venture between the two firms. Win-win? The deal lets PayPal shoulder into Discover's existing stable of merchant bank processors and could mark the watershed moment for the service where it emerges into a more mainstream brick-and-mortar payment alternative. For its part, Discover diversifies by grabbing extra fees from processing transactions and hitches itself to a promising partner in the mobile wallet war.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 2 Comments
  • DELL-OLD

    Dell (DELL-OLD -6.5%) is receiving plenty of negative commentary after a Q2 revenue miss and...

    Dell (DELL-OLD -6.5%) is receiving plenty of negative commentary after a Q2 revenue miss and guidance cut bring shares near their 52-week low.  "Where do we find the lost revenues and profits from the PC world? Are they in Washington? Greece? Cupertino?," Needham rhetorically asks, while arguing Windows 8's success is now critical. Goldman (Sell) notes EPS wouldn't have beaten estimates if not for one-time tax and margin benefits. HPQ -2%. INTC -1.1%. AMD -2%. (more) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM | 1 Comment
  • DFS

    Discover (DFS +5%) and PayPal ink a deal giving the eBAY (EBAY +3.9%) unit access to...

    Discover (DFS +5%) and PayPal ink a deal giving the eBAY (EBAY +3.9%) unit access to Discover's network (7M+ retailers). Under the agreement, PayPal will issue payment cards to its 50M users allowing them to make payments anywhere Discover is accepted. PayPal will charge merchants a small fee, of which Discover will get a cut.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM | 3 Comments
  • ALXA

    Alexza Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ALXA) +4.2% premarket after receiving a compliance certificate...

    Alexza Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ALXA) +4.2% premarket after receiving a compliance certificate for its Adasuve manufacturing facility from the EU. Adasuve, a schizophrenic and bipolar disorder treatment, is ALXA's lone product candidate.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • MPG-OLD

    MPG Office Trust (NYSE:MPG-OLD) +10.4% premarket after a WSJ article suggests the REIT...

    MPG Office Trust (NYSE:MPG-OLD) +10.4% premarket after a WSJ article suggests the REIT hired an adviser to seek out a buyer or cash investment. With the potential to pick up a large chunk of the downtown Los Angeles skyline in one fell swoop, real estate stalwarts such as BAM, PDM and TPGI are said to be considering bids.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM
  • QIHU

    Qihoo 360 (NYSE:QIHU) +9.7% following its Q2 report. Though results were only in-line, the...

    Qihoo 360 (NYSE:QIHU) +9.7% following its Q2 report. Though results were only in-line, the Chinese browser, portal, and now search engine developer guided for Q3 revenue of $81M-$83M, above a $78.2M consensus. Traffic stats (the subject of some controversy) were also healthy: Monthly active users of PC products rose 14M Q/Q to 425M, clicks on Qihoo's browser home pages rose by 73M to 368M, and mobile security users reached 120M. Shares are now up 25% on the week. (PR) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM | 1 Comment

  • Market preview: It's a down day so far for global equities following a rather ungainly fall in...

    Market preview: It's a down day so far for global equities following a rather ungainly fall in Japanese exports and Dell's rather poor earnings report, and ahead of the FOMC minutes, which are likely to be parsed to death. Not to mention Greece returning to the agenda. S&P futures -0.2%. Dell is -5.6%, but Toll Brothers is +5% after its results and is taking its home-building buddies up with it, while retailer Williams-Sonoma is +8.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • WELL

    Premarket gainers: SRZ +59%. BKD +9%. QIHU +9%. WSM +9%. CHS +8%. AEO +6%. TOL +5%. ALXA +5%....

    Premarket gainers: SRZ +59%. BKD +9%. QIHU +9%. WSM +9%. CHS +8%. AEO +6%. TOL +5%. ALXA +5%.
    Losers: PPHM -7%. EXPR -7%. CLWR -6%. DELL-OLD -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • WSM

    The right recipe: Shares of Williams-Sonoma (NYSE:WSM) roar to a 10.5% gain premarket after the...

    The right recipe: Shares of Williams-Sonoma (NYSE:WSM) roar to a 10.5% gain premarket after the retailer's Q2 report (I, II) hits all the right notes. Not only are comparable-store sales and margins improving as organic growth remains strong, but catalog sales are also marching higher for the first time in two years.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM
  • LEN

    Toll Brothers' ([[TOL] +4.4%) sterling FQ3 results and bright outlook is boosting shares of its...

    Toll Brothers' ([[TOL] +4.4%) sterling FQ3 results and bright outlook is boosting shares of its peer companies, with Lennar (NYSE:LEN) +1.8%, PulteGroup (NYSE:PHM) +2.5% and D.R. Horton (NYSE:DHI) +1.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM
  • ATPAQ

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG) +13.5% premarket, apparently thanks to a press release...

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG) +13.5% premarket, apparently thanks to a press release clarifying that its U.K. operations are not part of the parent's Chapter 11 reorganization and refinancing filing.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM | 1 Comment
  • AEO

    More on American Eagle Outfitters (NYSE:AEO): Comparable-store sales up 9% Y/Y. Decreased...

    More on American Eagle Outfitters (NYSE:AEO): Comparable-store sales up 9% Y/Y. Decreased product costs and markdowns helped improve profitability. SG&A expenses fell 40 bps to 24.0%. Number of stores stayed flat during the quarter. Sees Q3 EPS of $0.37-$0.38 and boosts full-year EPS guidance to $1.33-$1.36. Shares +6.8% premarket to $22.20, a 52-week high. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:23 AM | 1 Comment
  • AEO

    American Eagle Outfitters (NYSE:AEO): Q2 EPS of $0.21 in-line. Revenue of $740M (+11% Y/Y) beats...

    American Eagle Outfitters (NYSE:AEO): Q2 EPS of $0.21 in-line. Revenue of $740M (+11% Y/Y) beats by $21M. Shares +6.7% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:20 AM
  • NOK

    Nokia (NYSE:NOK) shares +4.35% following a couple of positive Bloomberg articles, one of which...

    Nokia (NYSE:NOK) shares +4.35% following a couple of positive Bloomberg articles, one of which highlights the success in emerging markets of the handset maker's cheap Asha features phones. Bloomberg also reports that Verizon (NYSE:VZ) plans to sell a Windows 8 Nokia phone later this year as it seeks to lower its dependance on the iPhone (NASDAQ:AAPL) and Android (NASDAQ:GOOG).
     
     
     
     
    | 8:17 AM | 3 Comments
  • TOL

    More on Toll Brothers (TOL +3.7%) FQ3: net profit +46% to $61.6M, net signed contracts +57%,...

    More on Toll Brothers (TOL +3.7%) FQ3: net profit +46% to $61.6M, net signed contracts +57%, backlog +59%. Reservation deposits +59% in first three weeks of FQ4. For 2012, expects home-sale revenue of $1.71B-$1.84B. "We are enjoying the most sustained demand we have experienced in over five years," says CEO Douglas Yearly.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:52 AM | 2 Comments
  • WELL

    Health Care REIT (HCN) purchases Sunrise Senior Living (SRZ) for $14.50 a share, marking a 62%...

    Health Care REIT (HCN) purchases Sunrise Senior Living (SRZ) for $14.50 a share, marking a 62% premium over the company's closing price yesterday. The transaction is expected to close in the first half of 2013. SRZ +59.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:43 AM

  • Asian shares follow Wall St. lower after Japan's wider-than-expected trade deficit and Dell's...

    Asian shares follow Wall St. lower after Japan's wider-than-expected trade deficit and Dell's disappointing earnings report, and ahead of meetings between Greece and European leaders, and the FOMC minutes. Japan -0.3%, Hong Kong -0.9%, China -0.8%, India -0.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 AM
